panels.description: Allows you to see the number of jobs currently being executed, awaiting execution, or being stopped so you can assess the efficiency of your system. As a job is either started or stopped, the chart gets updated accordingly. If the long-running workflows functionality is enabled, the widget also displays metrics on suspended and resumed jobs.

targets.rawSql: SELECT countExecuting AS "Running Jobs", countPending AS "Pending Jobs", countStopping AS "Stopping Jobs", countTerminating AS "Terminating Jobs", countSuspended AS "Suspended Jobs", countResumed AS "Resumed Jobs", date_queried AS "Date" FROM ${tenant}_DB.triggered_job_states

panels.title: Triggered Jobs States

panels.description: Allows you to see running jobs in the selected interval broken down into specific timeframes. Starting a new job results in a job number increase for the past hour. Please note that jobs started within schedules are taken into account as well.

targets.rawSql: SELECT countExecuting AS "Executed", pointInTime AS "Date" FROM ${tenant}_DB.completed_jobs_timeframe

panels.title: Running Jobs Timeframe

panels.description: Allows you to see the jobs timeline in the selected interval broken down according to their final state. It enables you to have an overview of the number of jobs finished or stopped. Stopping a job causes the corresponding information here to update accordingly. As long as a job is not yet finished, it is not taken into account in this widget.

targets.rawSql: SELECT countSuccessful AS "Successful", countErrors AS "Faulted", countStopped AS "Stopped", pointInTime AS "Date" FROM ${tenant}_DB.completed_jobs_timeline

panels.title: Completed Jobs Timeline

panels.description: Allows you to see precise figures of the final job states. Enables you to see if there are many jobs that are either faulted or stopped and implicitly make sure that the system is healthy. Starting or stopping a job causes the corresponding information from this widget to update accordingly. As long as a job is not yet finished, it is not taken into account in this widget.

targets.rawSql: SELECT countSuccessful AS "Successful", countErrors AS "Faulted", countStopped AS "Stopped", date_queried AS "Date" FROM ${tenant}_DB.completed_jobs_overview

panels.title: Completed Jobs Overview

panels.description: Displays the average pending time for each individual process.

targets.rawSql: SELECT averagePendingTimeInSeconds AS "Avg.Pending Time", processName AS "Process", date_queried AS "Date" FROM ${tenant}_DB.process_details_table

panels.title: Average Pending Time (seconds)

panels.description: Allows you to see information pertaining to each process and the corresponding jobs metrics. If a Robot starts executing a new job, the corresponding information updates accordingly. The total number of processes is displayed in parentheses after the widget name.

targets.rawSql: SELECT processName AS "Process", countExecuting AS "Running", countPending AS "Pending", countSuspended AS "Suspended", countResumed AS "Resumed", countSuccessful AS "Successful", countStopped AS "Stopped", countErrors AS "Faulted", averageDurationInSeconds AS "Avg.Duration", averagePendingTimeInSeconds AS "Avg.Pending Time", date_queried AS "Date" FROM ${tenant}_DB.process_details_table

panels.title: Processes Details
